multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a mole on my cheek that used to be stable but has started growing rapidly on one side and sometimes it bleeds on its own.
How long has the mole been changing in size and bleeding?
The mole started growing rapidly and bleeding a few weeks ago.
Do you have any personal or family history of skin cancer?
I don't have any information about personal or family history of skin cancer.
Have you noticed any change in the color or texture of the mole?
Yes, the mole has turned into a tan-brown color and it now has an irregular shape with a rough texture in some areas.
Have you experienced any other new skin changes elsewhere on your body or symptoms such as weight loss, fatigue, or night sweats?
No, I haven't experienced any other new skin changes or symptoms like weight loss, fatigue, or night sweats.
Final Diagnosis: Malignant Melanoma
